recipe1.cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices, grill until cooked. In a separate pan, simmer tomato puree with cream, butter, and spices. Add grilled chicken to the sauce and simmer until flavors meld.

recipe2.cooking_method: Blanch spinach, blend into a puree. Sauté onions, add ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes. Add spinach puree and paneer cubes. Simmer until the flavors blend.

recipe3.cooking_method: Marinate meat in yogurt and spices. Parboil rice. Layer rice and meat in a pot, top with fried onions and saffron-infused milk. Seal and cook on low heat until rice is fluffy.

description: Vikas Khanna is an award-winning Indian chef, restaurateur, cookbook writer, filmmaker, and humanitarian. He is known for his modern take on Indian cuisine and his efforts to promote Indian culinary traditions globally.

recipe1.cooking_method: Soak chickpeas overnight, then boil until tender. Sauté onions, add tomatoes and spices. Serve with fried bread (bhature) and garnish with onions and lemon.

recipe2.cooking_method: Pressure cook lentils until soft. Sauté onions, add tomatoes and spices. Add cooked lentils and simmer until flavors meld. Temper with garlic and cumin seeds.

recipe3.cooking_method: Sauté potatoes and cauliflower with spices until tender. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with roti or rice.

description: Sanjeev Kapoor is an Indian celebrity chef, entrepreneur, and television personality. He is widely regarded as one of the most prominent chefs in India. Kapoor is best known for his TV show 'Khana Khazana,' which is one of the longest-running cookery shows in Asia.

recipe1.cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and tandoori masala. Grill until cooked through, charred at the edges.

recipe2.cooking_method: Marinate paneer cubes, bell peppers, and onions in yogurt and tandoori masala. Skewer and grill until charred.

recipe3.cooking_method: Marinate lamb in yogurt and spices. Sauté onions, add tomatoes and spices. Add marinated lamb and simmer until tender.

description: Ranveer Brar is an Indian celebrity chef, TV show host, and judge on various cooking shows. He is known for his innovative cooking style and for promoting traditional Indian cuisine with a modern twist.

recipe1.cooking_method: Pressure cook lentils and beans until soft. Simmer with cream, butter, and ginger-garlic paste until flavors meld.

recipe2.cooking_method: Sauté paneer cubes and tomato gravy with cream, cashews, and garam masala. Simmer until creamy and rich.

recipe3.cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices, grill until cooked. Simmer tomato puree with cream, butter, and spices. Add grilled chicken to the sauce and simmer until flavors meld.

description: Manish Mehrotra is an Indian celebrity chef known for his innovative take on Indian cuisine. He is the chef and co-owner of the Indian Accent restaurant, which has been featured in Asia's 50 Best Restaurants list.

recipe1.cooking_method: Cook vegetables until soft, mash with spices. Serve with buttered bread rolls.

recipe2.cooking_method: Sauté paneer cubes with tomato puree, cream, butter, and kasuri methi. Simmer until creamy and aromatic.

recipe3.cooking_method: Stuff spiced mashed potatoes into rolled dough, cook on a griddle with ghee until golden brown.

description: Saransh Goila is an Indian chef, TV show host, and author. He is best known for winning the Food Food Maha Challenge and hosting the TV show 'Roti Rasta aur India.' He is also the founder of 'Goila Butter Chicken,' a chain of Indian restaurants.

recipe1.cooking_method: Marinate fish in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and tandoori masala. Grill until cooked through, charred at the edges.

recipe2.cooking_method: Parboil rice. Sauté mixed vegetables, layer with rice, and saffron-infused milk. Seal and cook on low heat until rice is fluffy.

recipe3.cooking_method: Blend mango, yogurt, sugar, and cardamom until smooth. Serve chilled with ice cubes.

description: Vineet Bhatia is an Indian-born British chef, restaurateur, and food consultant. He is known for his innovative approach to Indian cuisine, often referred to as 'Modern Indian' or 'Indian with a twist.' Bhatia is the owner of several restaurants, including 'Rasoi' in London, which was awarded a Michelin star in 2001.
